summary_comment: The professor demonstrates exceptional care for her students and a strong commitment to teaching Portuguese in a practical, engaging manner. She utilizes diverse teaching materials to maintain student interest and focuses on conversation-based learning to enhance skills. Her grading is lenient, and she shows great understanding and flexibility regarding students' personal lives.

Ratings.comment: Professor who really cares about her students and teaching Portuguese. She makes the class relevant to the real world and uses all sorts of teaching materials to keep students involved. She is an easy grader and very understanding of her students and their lives. Your skills will improve if you come to class as her teaching is conversation-heavy.

summary_comment: Nikolas is highly regarded as an exceptional lecturer who genuinely cares about his students' well-being and education. Students consistently praise his preparedness, engaging discussions, and supportive demeanor, often describing him as the "GOAT" (greatest of all time). His teaching approach is praised for making complex content accessible and fostering a positive, enjoyable learning environment.

Ratings.comment: 3403: Nikolas is the GOAT! He is a great lecturer and you can tell he truly cares about his students. I always look forward to his class and by far have learned the most from his teaching out of all my Spanish professors at this school. There are a few papers we had to do but they were not bad at all. If you see his name on schedule planner, DO IT!

I've taken two classes with Nik, the second by choice, and I would take all the rest of mine with him if I could. He cares about your wellbeing AND your education. He comes to class prepared, prompts engaging discussions, and his expectations are clear. 10/10 would recommend.

Nik is actually just the best ever! Makes content accessible and is so kind and caring towards his students. Genuinely cares about you as a person and a student. Makes the class mood so positive and enjoyable. He also never judges you and constantly makes the class laugh. Like someone above said, just the absolute GOAT. Overall amazing instructor!
Absolute GOAT.
He was very helpful when grading papers and didn't grade too hard - he was also very nice and would almost immediately respond to emails. I liked him a lot !

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and supportive approach. Students find her grading to be fair and forgiving, with good grades attainable through consistent effort and a genuine desire to learn. Her dedication to her students is evident, making the coursework both challenging and rewarding.

Ratings.comment: She was really great, her grading was easy and as long as you invested time into the class and wanted to learn you got good grades! She was understanding if you didn't really grasp the concepts and always was willing to help you. I had such a great experience!

Is a great professor who really cares for her students. There is daily homework but they help you to learn some Spanish and don't take much time. The grading is pretty easy and if you try it is very easy to attain an A.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, effectively explaining complex concepts and providing valuable new perspectives that enhance students' understanding of Spanish. Her workload is well-balanced and enjoyable, making her classes a standout experience for all students.

Ratings.comment: If I could have her for every Spanish class I would. She explains things incredibly well and also opens up a lot of important new perspectives that ANYONE taking Spanish should open their eyes to. I thought the amount of work perfectly matched the requirements for the course, and I had a lot of fun taking her class.
the loml. I wish I had her for every Spanish class ever.

summary_comment: Prof. Vazquez excels in her teaching, maintaining a highly engaging and enthusiastic classroom environment despite the challenges of the Spanish department. Her effectiveness is evident in her ability to keep students interested and committed, even those who are only勉强参加。她关心学生的学习和教学内容，确保学生在困难的课程中也能取得成功。

Ratings.comment: Despite how bad the Spanish department is, Prof. Vazquez is incredible. She is funny, teaches well, and cares about her students and what she is teaching. She keeps a class of people only there because they are required to be engaged and excited to learn. She will set you up for success in a challenging class!

summary_comment: Professor Miranda is highly regarded for her caring and respectful approach, making her class engaging and easy to connect with despite its challenges. Students appreciate her clear expectations, timely feedback, and supportive demeanor, noting that while the workload can be demanding, especially with the group project, it is manageable with consistent effort. Overall, she is highly recommended for her passion for teaching and ability to make Spanish classes enjoyable and effective.

Ratings.comment: Lauren is great! She's a very caring, respectful, and nice professor. The class itself was a little challenging, but if you attend class, do the practices, homework's, and reach out when you need it, you'll be fine. There were 3 exams, 4 tareas that covered materials for the exam, pruebas and little assignments every week, and then a cuml. final.

Gave great feedback and expectations were very clear. Class was fairly interesting and she was very nice and helpful with assignments. Weekly quizzes were online and easy. 4 tareas (few pages of questions) and field notebooks, sometimes took a bit of time. Final was a group project, which were pretty work heavy, but not too difficult
She was a very kind and understanding professor. Understood our busy lives as college students and was very easy to relate and connect with. Would 100% recommend her class

I loved Professor Miranda. She is very engaging with everyone in class and has a lot of different activities in class to help you learn. I always loved going to spanish class even though it was an early class. She is one of my favorite professor at OSU. 100% would take again.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching skills and organizational abilities. Students find her approachable, responsive, and effective at simplifying complex concepts, making her classes both engaging and manageable despite the volume of assignments. She is consistently praised for her dedication and teaching prowess.

Ratings.comment: great professor, would take the class again! She is very helpful and loves to teach!

She's an awesome instructor. There's a lot of weekly modules to do (readings, quizzes, exercises, etc.) but it's so organized and manageable. There are so many tiny assignments that it's easier to bring grades up. Assignments/exams are open book. She makes complicated concepts seem super easy. Very responsive and understanding. Highly recommend!
Palo is an awesome teacher!
Great Spanish teacher :)

summary_comment: Dr. Lopez is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, known for being incredibly knowledgeable, understanding, and caring. Students consistently praise his ability to explain concepts clearly and his dedication to helping them master the material. His classes are challenging but supportive, fostering a deep understanding of Spanish language and culture.

Ratings.comment: Took SPAN 203 at UNC with Dr. Lopez. He's incredibly nice, understanding, knowledgable, and gives good feedback. Very fair grader. Definitely one of the better Spanish professors I have had. Exams are not written by him but are very straightforward for 203 at UNC.

I did not mind having Giovani. The class itself is a hard class, therefore it was hard to determine if Govani was at fault or the Ohio State Spanish Department. He wanted to make sure you knew what you were doing. Sometimes he cracked down on pronunciation and participation. I would take him again if it were a different class.

Professor Lopez was one of the best professors I will probably ever have. He really cares about his students and explains things in a way that is understanding. I learned so much in this class. There is a lot of in class speaking but I kinda enjoyed that part. Very understanding and considerate professor.
He is great. Really cares about his students. Helped me learn more Spanish than I ever did in high school. Totally recommend

Professor Lopez clearly cares about his students being able to understand the material, and goes to great lengths to make sure it happens. I think I would better understand the language if I had learned from someone like him sooner.

summary_comment: Julian is highly regarded for his engaging and cheerful teaching style, which makes learning Spanish enjoyable and effective. Students appreciate his dedication and willingness to help, often setting aside extra time to ensure their understanding and progress. His approach creates a supportive and safe learning environment that encourages active participation and question-asking.

Ratings.comment: I took this professors Spanish 122 class at Greenriver College. He was very cheerful and brought the learning to the students through jokes and poking fun with the students. The course setup was high quality and made learning the language easy as long as you did the work.

Unfortunately I took this class online. I do not think many other instructors could make the course as enjoyable as Julian did. The course quickly became one of my favorites in my weekly schedule and I looked forward to Spanish. He is an instructor who truly cares and will set aside time to make sure his students are learning and improving. 10/10

I had Julian for multiple semesters of Spanish and I couldn't be more grateful! He was an awesome teacher who knew what he was doing. Julian made the classroom feel like a safe learning space where students could engage and would not be afraid to ask questions. I also experienced online classes with him and he continued to deliver great lectures.

Julien was a great TA. He really took the time to make sure the information he was trying to pass on made sense, and he worked to meet his students where they were at. Truly a gem in all honesty, but to get the most of this class and his teaching you need to be willing to engage and participate! Stay on top of homework and you will be just fine.
Awesome guy, even though he was just a TA. Cares a lot about his students.

summary_comment: The professor is rated as average, with students finding her classes unengaging despite her approachability. Her teaching style is straightforward, with clear criteria and minimal attendance checks, though assignments lack specific due dates, which can be confusing.

Ratings.comment: She's nice, but the class I took was so boring, this rating isn't because she's bad, its because she's average and couldn't elevate a boring class

Brooklee taught my ASC College Survey. She is originally an advisor from the Spanish & Portuguese department. The criteria for the class were pretty clear, and she minimally took attendance (maybe once or twice the whole semester). The lectures were easy and the assignments even easier. Be aware: the assignments do not have clear due dates.

SEI.Subject: ARTSSCI
SEI.Class Name: Arts and Sciences Survey: Arts and Humanities

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his excellent teaching quality, as evidenced by student comments indicating that his office hours are extremely beneficial. He provides in-depth explanations, clearly distinguishing between important and less critical information, which effectively prepares students for quizzes and exams.

Ratings.comment: Office hours help a lot, he explains everything in depth and what's important and what not, really prepares you for quizzes and exams

summary_comment: The professor is highly effective, ensuring students are well-prepared for exams and quizzes through thorough engagement. Class participation is encouraged, making learning both accessible and interactive.

Ratings.comment: Really great professor, took the time to make sure everyone was prepared for exams and quizzes. Made it easy to engage in class.

summary_comment: The professor provided a largely self-paced, textbook-driven course with supplementary video modules, focusing on completion-based grading rather than deep engagement. Student feedback indicates minimal direct instruction, with responses to emails often delayed. Overall, the course felt more like independent study than a traditional lecture-based class.

Ratings.comment: He didn't teach -- he had us read the textbook and go through modules with videos of other instructors. Just tab the important pages in the textbook to flip to during assignments and you'll do fine since they're graded for completion, except tareas and exams. He took several days to respond to emails so it was pretty much a self-taught course.

summary_comment: Mark is a highly effective and caring professor known for his meticulous preparation and engaging teaching style. Students appreciate his accessibility, clear communication of class expectations, and his efforts to ensure they succeed, even offering extra study sessions. His humor and dedication to student success make him stand out as one of the best language teachers at OSU.

Ratings.comment: While the class was definitely difficult for someone not great at Spanish, Mark was easily accessible and spent time focusing on the hardest concepts in virtual class. He also made clear the schedule and grading of the class which was appreciated by someone who wanted to know how to plan and how to do well in the class.
Mark is a very caring and good professor. He always made little jokes during lectures that made us laugh and kept the class interactive. Not hard at all to get an A.

Mark is a caring prof and a super nice grader. He wants you to succeed and always answers questions in depth. Found out I took this class and didnt need to but I appreciate the extra A in a 4 credit class. Even if you have never taken Spanish before such as myself you will learn something and catch on if you do your hw, ask ?s, read the textbook.

Mark completely changed my outlook on the Spanish and Portuguese Department at OSU. He is one of the most influential and caring professors I have ever encountered in the classroom. He was very kind and wanted to see that every student was treated equally and learned the material. I hope to see him teaching more classes next semester!

Mark was the best language teacher I've ever encountered. He prepares meticulously and expects students to pay effort in and outside of the classroom, which is critical for language study. He designs classroom activities that help students to initiate and engage in natural conversations. A hilarious guy who truly cares about his students.

Mark was by far one of the best Professors I have ever had at OSU! With a very laid back classroom participation was highly encouraged and I almost always had a great time attending class. Despite the quick coverage of Spanish 100 and 102 in one semester Mark went out of his way to hold three extra study sessions for 2 hours to go in deeper content

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his ability to effectively teach beginners, providing clear and accessible explanations that make complex concepts understandable. His teaching quality is consistently praised for its clarity and student-friendliness.

Ratings.comment: Very good for beginners

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality and caring nature. Students consistently praise her for her ability to explain concepts clearly, her availability during office hours, and her willingness to provide support. Her dedication to helping students succeed is evident, and she effectively challenges them while ensuring they feel supported throughout the course.

Ratings.comment: She is such a kind and caring teacher. She truly cares about her students and if you are struggling in this class, you can easily go up to her and ask for help. I completely forgot to turn my final project in on time because I had so many other exams and she was really understanding and let me turn it in late. Definitely recommend

I think she did a great job at explaining and making sure every concept is understood. She made time for her students to come to office hours and be able to understand each terms. I would recommend her to every one because she helped me understand despite signing up for the course last minute.

Ashlee was one of the best grad student teachers I've ever had. Super sweet, oral exams were not scary as she is very friendly. Exams are just like practice exams so make to do those. Also, there is weekly homeworks which force you to read the text book, and that's actually a grade booster if you try on those.

Ashlee was a great instructor. I know that my Spanish speaking and pronunciation skills have DRASTICALLY improved from this class. From all of the Spanish classes I have taken so far, I have learned the most from this one thanks to Ashlee. She was always willing to help and it is beyond obvious how dedicated and motivated she is to teaching .

Ashlee is an amazing teacher. We gave her feedback and she responded to it clearly and understood the needs of the class. It is not an easy class as you analyze more advanced Spanish, but she is awesome, and also super helpful during office hours. She's a student too, so she understands what's going on.

Ashlee is a GTA but she has great credibility. She likes to remind the class that she was once/still is a student and she doesn't want to make things too difficult for us in class, but she will challenge you and you will get out of the class what you put in. She is very willing to work with you, but you need to express your want for help!

summary_comment: Angela is an effective instructor known for her comprehensive approach to teaching, including four exams and four papers with the option to drop the lowest exam score. She assigns substantial homework that she reviews in class, ensuring students stay engaged and well-prepared. Her interactive teaching style encourages participation, with random calls on students to ensure active involvement.

Ratings.comment: Angela's a great instructor. There were 4 exams & 4 papers, but you get to drop your lowest exam. There was a lot of homework that she always goes over in class. She occasionally calls on people randomly but this is usually only is when people don't talk in class. She often goes around the room and makes everyone talk but that is to be expected.
